newsitem.title: FRANCE: Morgan Stanley maintains Danone recommendation.
newsitem.headline: Morgan Stanley maintains Danone recommendation.

text.p: Brokerage Morgan Stanley on Friday maintained its 'outperform' recommendation on Danone, after the group released "slightly" better than expected 1996 results.
In a note to investors, the broker also said Danone would benefit from a progressive increase in sales volume in 1997 and a continued improvement in its operating profit margin.
Morgan Stanley also said the valuation of Danone was "attractive" when compared to its main competitors in Europe.
Danone has reported a 1996 net profit rise of eight percent to 3.38 billion francs.

Morgan Stanley said 1996 accounts showed sales volume growth accelerated in last quarter of the year while the group achieved a better control over the costs of production and raw materials and higher selling prices.
The broker added the profit rise would have been stronger if poor summer weather conditions had not hurt mineral water and beer sales.
